tool.name: Vibrational spectra signal processing toolbox
tool.description: A collection of tools for pre-processing vibrational spectral data such as FT-IR and Raman spectra
tool.command: Rscript $__tool_directory__/vssp_wrapper.R dataMatrix_in "$dataMatrix_in" sampleMetadata_in "$sampleMetadata_in" baseline "$bc.baseline" baseline_param "$bc.bl_param" norm_name "$norm.norm_type" norm_param "$norm.norm_param" smooth "$sm.smooth" sm_param "$sm.sm_param" mos "$mos" output_log "$output_log" output_data "$output_data" file_figures "$figures"

param.name: norm_param
param.label: Normalization parameter: the order of polynomial

param.name: mos
param.label: Calculate Signal-to-noise ratios using morphological scores?

tool.help:
=============================================== Signal processing tools for vibrational spectra ===============================================
.. class:: infomark
**Authors** Yun Xu (Metaboflow, University of Liverpool)
----------- Description -----------
| This tool provides a collection of signal processing methods aimed for vibrational spectra (e.g. FT-IR, Raman) data pre-processing.
----------- Input files -----------
+-------------------------------+---------+ | Parameters: | Format | +===============================+=========+ | 1 : Data matrix file | csv | +-------------------------------+---------+ | 2 : Sample metadata file | csv | +-------------------------------+---------+
|This toolbox provides a set of tools to perform common signal processing techniques for vibrational spectra includes: (1) asymmetrically reweighted penalized least square smoothing (arPLS) for baseline correction; (2) Smooth using Gaussian filter; (3) normalize spectra using standard normal variate (SNV), extended multiplicative signal correction (EMSC) or to sum of squares of 1. A multivariate statistic called morphological scores is also provided to assess the signal-to-noise raito of each spectra, useful to remove poor samples.
---------- Parameters ----------
Baseline correction? | "yes" for performing baseline correction using arpls, a smooth parameter need to be provided with 1000000 as default, "no" to skip. |
Smooth the spectra? | "yes" for smoothing using gaussian filter, a window width need to be provided with 7 as default, "no" to skip. |
Type of normalization | Select signal normalization method, can be SNV, to sum of squares of 1 or EMSC. EMSC requires the order of polynomial to be set with 3 as default. Chose "none" to skip. | Calculate Signal-to-noise ratios using morphological scores? | Chose "yes" to calculate morphological scores for each spectrum which will be added as an extra column named "mos" to the final results, "no" to skip. A rule of thumb is that mos lower than 3 are the ones of poor SNR. |
------------ Output files ------------
vssp_output_data.csv | The spectra after chosen signal processing steps performed. An extra column of "mos" would appear if the user had selected to calculate morphological scores. |
vssp_figure.pdf | A figure of all the processed spectra plotted together. |
vssp_output_log.txt | Text file of running messages. |
